intro: Dortmanna paludosa, commonly known as the bog moss, is a small, mat-forming evergreen plant belonging to the family Sphagnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and its ability to thrive in wet, acidic environments such as bogs and peatlands. The plant has a complex structure with specialized cells that help it retain water, contributing to its survival in waterlogged soils. It plays a crucial role in peat formation by decomposing slowly and accumulating organic matter. Dortmanna paludosa is an important indicator species for undisturbed wetland ecosystems.
